penalizedLMM 0.1.0
  • Reference

    Evaluate the negative log-likelihood of a non-null Gaussian plmm model

    plmm_nll_nonnull.Rd

    Evaluate the negative log-likelihood of a non-null Gaussian plmm model

    Usage

    plmm_nll_nonnull(fit, SUX, SUy, S, eta)

    Arguments

    fit

    An object of class plmm_fit.

    SUX

    Rotated design matrix including rotated intercept and unpenalized columns, if present.

    SUy

    Rotated outcome vector.

    S

    Eigenvalues from similarity matrix used for model fitting.

    eta

    Estimated $eta$ value from object fit.

    Examples

    admix$K <- (1/nrow(admix$X))*tcrossprod(admix$X, admix$X) # create an estimated covariance matrix 
# NB: this is an estimate of K 
K_svd <- svd(K)
#> Error in as.matrix(x): object 'K' not found
U <- K_svd$u
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'K_svd' not found
D <- K_svd$d
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'K_svd' not found
# WORK IN PROGRESS #FIXME need to iron out this example
# See pp. 16-18 in A.R.'s thesis 
ev <- eigen(admix$V)
#> Error in array(x, c(length(x), 1L), if (!is.null(names(x))) list(names(x),     NULL) else NULL): 'data' must be of a vector type, was 'NULL'
U <- ev$vectors
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'ev' not found
S <- ev$values
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'ev' not found
UX <- U%*%admix$X
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'U' not found
Uy <- U%*%admix$y
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'U' not found
fit <- plmm(X = admix$X, y = admix$y, V = admix$V, penalty = "MCP")
(plmm_nll_nonnull(fit = my_fit, SUX = S%*%UX, SUy = S%*%admix$y, S = S, eta = my_fit$eta))
#> Error in plmm_nll_nonnull(fit = my_fit, SUX = S %*% UX, SUy = S %*% admix$y,     S = S, eta = my_fit$eta): object 'S' not found
